sen.j: 大島高任（おおしまたかとう、文政9年（1826年）-明治34年（1901年））は明治時代の鉱山学者。
sen.e: Takato OSHIMA (1826 - 1901) was a mining scientist of the Meiji period.

sen.j: 箕作阮甫や坪井信道に学び、長崎で、採鉱術を学ぶ。
sen.e: He studied under Genpo MITSUKURI and Shindo TSUBOI, and studied mining technology in Nagasaki.

sen.j: やがて、藩に戻り鉱山開発に努め、維新後には岩倉使節団に同行、ヨーロッパの鉱山を視察、帰国後は日本鉱業会の初代会長を務めた。
sen.e: He subsequently returned to his domain and made efforts in mine development, and after the Meiji Restoration, he accompanied the Iwakura Mission (a Japanese diplomatic journey to Europe and the United States between 1871 and 1873 by the top officials of the new Meiji government) to visit and study mines in Europe, and after returning to Japan, he became the first chairman of Mining and Metallurgical Institute of Japan.

sen.j: 後年、那須野の開墾にも携わり、葡萄園と葡萄酒醸造所の設営に係る。
sen.e: Later in life, he was also involved in reclamation of Nasuno district, and was engaged in establishment of a vineyard and a winery.
